content: Looks like the error-chain crate is also unmaintained. Unlike the failure crate, it isn't marked as deprecated/unmaintained though. it's not owned by rust-lang on crates.io, but the repository is in rust-lang-nursery. not sure if that makes it 'our' crate or not, and if we should mark it as deprecated or just leave things as is.

@Jane Lusby should have a better idea of the state of error handling crates. I'm in favor of moving it to rust-lang-deprecated since AFAIK it's superseded by other crates which are actually maintained.
yea to my knowledge error-chain has been completely superseded by more recent derive crates such as thiserror and snafu. +1 to deprecating
I think it would be appropriate to deprecate, with a pointer to thiserror for the same style of error enum.
